text:
Pieter Robert ("Rob") Rensenbrink (; 3 July 1947 – 24 January 2020) was a Dutch footballer. He was a member of the Dutch national football team. He reached two World Cup finals in 1974 and 1978. He was also the first winner of the Onze d'Or.
In 2015, Rensenbrink was diagnosed with progressive muscular atrophy. He died on 24 January 2020 from the disease, aged 72.
